components.title: Learning Path
components.description: We start by getting to know the territories, understanding their needs and creating with the active stakeholders a laboratorial journey based on measurable and concrete results

components.title: Impact Generation
components.description: We empower a new collaborative generation of business owners by transfering knowlege on enterpreneurship, sustainability, impact measurement and open organisation design

components.title: Measurement
components.description: We drive a culture of impact measurement and transparent communication enabling data driven decisions, engagement, funds attraction and open participation

components.title:
We give shape to complex
sustainable territorial transformations

slides.title: Tailor Made
slides.description: We co-design a tailor made training path composed by a set of micromasters that transfer the needed knowledge to a territory

slides.title: Agile
slides.description: Communities deliver value by continuously evaluating plans, activities and outcomes in an iterative approach

slides.title: Results Driven
slides.description: All participants practice the immediate application of the acquired skills, generating tangible results

slides.title: Hybrid
slides.description: Residentials trainings are mixed with online sessions to combine the need for human relations with the digital accessibility

cards.title: Territorial Catalog
cards.description: Co-create an experiences, products and services catalog representing the territorial identity

cards.title: Impact Management
cards.description: Identify, plan, execute, measure, assess and transparently communicate the impact narrative inside and outside the territory

cards.title: Community Enterprise
cards.description: Create a local organisation where anyone generating positive impact can actively participate to the decision making process

cards.title: Multi-Channel Distribution
cards.description: Promote the catalog to remote workers, travelers, enterprises,  schools and locals through OTAs, DMOs or community websites
